value:
An eye patch worn by the Mirage
Master Kiria.

A hair ornament worn by the Mirage
Master Tsubasa.

Clear the Grand Hero Battle against Cynthia:
Hero Chaser with Anna: Commander on your
team.

Clear the Grand Hero Battle against Cynthia:
Hero Chaser on Lunatic or higher difficulty
with Cynthia: Hero Chaser on your team.

Defeat Cynthia: Hero Chaser at level 40 or
higher with Anna: Commander.

Defeat Cynthia: Hero Chaser at level 40 or
higher with Cynthia: Hero Chaser.

Clear the Grand Hero Battle against Cynthia:
Hero Chaser on Lunatic or higher difficulty
using only armored allies.
Clear one of the final maps in Tempest Trials.
Clear one of the final maps in Tempest Trials.
Clear one of the final maps in Tempest Trials.
Clear one of the final maps in Tempest Trials.
Clear one of the final maps in Tempest Trials.
Clear one of the final maps in Tempest Trials.
Clear one of the final maps in Tempest Trials.
Clear one of the final maps in Tempest Trials.

Defeat the boss Tsubasa of floors 16-20 in
Tap Battle.
Clear a stage in Tap Battle.
Clear a stage in Tap Battle.

Defeat the boss Mamori of floors 56-60 in
Tap Battle.
Clear a stage in Tap Battle.
Clear a stage in Tap Battle.

Defeat the boss Kiria of floors 76-80 in
Tap Battle.
Clear a stage in Tap Battle.
Clear a stage in Tap Battle.

Defeat the boss Itsuki of floors 96-100 in
Tap Battle.
Clear a stage in Tap Battle.
Clear a stage in Tap Battle.

Clear Extra Stage 2 in Tap Battle. (Extra Stage
2 is playable after Extra Stage 1 unlocks.)

Clear Paralogue 42: Part 1 on Lunatic difficulty
with a lance ally on your team. (Allies deployed
as cohorts using Pair Up do not count.) All four
allies must survive.

Clear Paralogue 42: Part 2 on Lunatic difficulty
with an axe ally on your team. (Allies deployed
as cohorts using Pair Up do not count.) All four
allies must survive.

Clear Paralogue 42: Part 3 on Lunatic difficulty
with a sword ally on your team. (Allies deployed
as cohorts using Pair Up do not count.) All four
allies must survive.

Young man who battles evil Mirages at Chrom's
side. A kindly leader to his comrades. Appears
in Tokyo Mirage Sessions ♯FE Encore.

Energetic high schooler and idol, partnered to
Caeda. She gives any job her all. Appears in
Tokyo Mirage Sessions ♯FE Encore.

A young half-Japanese actor who has Hollywood
dreams. Polishes her acting skills while piercing
enemies with Virion's arrows. Appears in Tokyo
Mirage Sessions ♯FE Encore.

Cute and courteous master of Draug. Under
the moniker Mamorin, she hosts a popular
cooking show for kids. Appears in Tokyo Mirage
Sessions ♯FE Encore.

A singer with a slick image and many fans.
Throws herself into battle alongside Tharja.
Appears in Tokyo Mirage Sessions ♯FE Encore.

An elementary-school-age idol who
fights using Draug. Using her Session
skills, she can grant up to Def/Res+15!

Effective against dragon foes. Grants Def+3.
If unit initiates combat, grants bonus to unit's
Atk/Def during combat = 3 + number of allies
who have already acted × 2 (max value of 7).
If foe initiates combat, grants bonus to unit's
Atk/Def during combat = 7 - number of foes
who have already acted × 2 (min value of 3).

Effective against armored and cavalry foes.
Grants Spd+3. If unit initiates combat after an
ally has already acted, grants Atk/Spd+6 during
combat and unit can make a follow-up attack
before foe can counterattack.

Grants Res+3. If unit is within 2 spaces of an
ally, grants Def/Res+6 to unit during combat
and foe cannot make a follow-up attack.

Effective against flying foes. Grants Spd+3.
If unit's Spd > foe's Spd, foe cannot make a
follow-up attack.

Grants Atk+3. Inflicts Atk/Res-6 on foes within
2 spaces during combat.

If unit initiates combat, grants bonus to unit's
Atk/Spd during combat = 1 + number of allies
who have already acted (max value of 3).

If unit initiates combat, grants bonus to unit's
Atk/Spd during combat = 2 + number of allies
who have already acted × 2 (max value of 6).

If unit initiates combat, grants bonus to unit's
Atk/Spd during combat = 3 + number of allies
who have already acted × 3 (max value of 9).

If foe initiates combat, grants bonus to unit's
Def/Res during combat = 3 - number of foes
who have already acted (min value of 1).

If foe initiates combat, grants bonus to unit's
Def/Res during combat = 6 - number of foes
who have already acted × 2 (min value of 2).

If foe initiates combat, grants bonus to unit's
Def/Res during combat = 9 - number of foes
who have already acted × 3 (min value of 3).

$aIf a Rally Assist skill is used by unit or targets
unit, inflicts Spd/Def-1 and【Guard】on
foes in cardinal directions of unit and target
through their next actions.

【Guard】
Inflicts Special cooldown charge -1 on target
per attack during combat through its next action.
(Only highest value applied. Does not stack.)

$aIf a Rally Assist skill is used by unit or targets
unit, inflicts Spd/Def-3 and【Guard】on
foes in cardinal directions of unit and target
through their next actions.

【Guard】
Inflicts Special cooldown charge -1 on target
per attack during combat through its next action.
(Only highest value applied. Does not stack.)

$aIf a Rally Assist skill is used by unit or targets
unit, inflicts Spd/Def-5 and【Guard】on
foes in cardinal directions of unit and target
through their next actions.

【Guard】
Inflicts Special cooldown charge -1 on target
per attack during combat through its next action.
(Only highest value applied. Does not stack.)

Inflicts Atk/Res-1 on foe and neutralizes foe's
bonuses to Atk/Res (from skills like Fortify,
Rally, etc.) during combat.

Inflicts Atk/Res-2 on foe and neutralizes foe's
bonuses to Atk/Res (from skills like Fortify,
Rally, etc.) during combat.

Inflicts Atk/Res-3 on foe and neutralizes foe's
bonuses to Atk/Res (from skills like Fortify,
Rally, etc.) during combat.

Long ago, the god of strength and the
goddess of love formed their own
respective empire and kingdom. That
empire one day turned against the
kingdom, engineering a coup, slaying
the rival king. The Deliverance, then,
seeking to retake the kingdom's fallen
castle, called for aid from the hero
Mycen. But when Mycen rejected
their pleas, his grandson Alm chose
to join the Deliverance in his place...
